snippet: J. Paul Reddam, owner of I’ll Have Another, studied philosophy before embarking on a career that includes horse racing and running a business that makes high-risk, high-interest loans.
abstract: J Paul Reddam, whose 3-year-old colt I'll Have Another will make a bid for the Triple Crown in the Belmont Stakes, has expressed support for the horse's trainer Doug O'Neill, who has been suspended by California racing authorities for his latest violation of racing rules regarding drugs; Reddam, who has been criticized for the methods he has employed in his high-risk, high-interest loan business, is familiar with being the target of unpleasant accusations.
lead_paragraph: J. Paul Reddam, owner of I’ll Have Another, studied philosophy before embarking on a career that includes horse racing and running a business that makes high-risk, high-interest loans.

headline.seo: Belmont Stakes: Reddam Is One Win From Triple Crown
headline.main: In Other Races: Paying Back the Owner of a Triple Crown Hopeful
